column4: URGENT: while running virtualbox (I need windows for work), after a while my whole computer will lock up.  then it will sort of come back but I'll have no more title bars, no more network, and system monitor shows Load at 100%. only fix so far is to reboot.  I've been using lucid since alpha3 and this just happened in the past couple days. please help!
i really wouldn't use a new release for work dude
if you press ALT+F2 and run: metacity --replace    do the bars come back
Alt+F2 doesn't work
then log off and log on to command line level and reinstall ubuntu-desktop
I'll try that, thanks
i'd just backup your virtualbox config etc and reinstall if worst comes to worse
I'm just surprised it's able to completely hose my system
its software, so anyting can
I know, but I've become accustomed to more stability with linux :)
I logged out and tried switching to a VC and I don't have any.  just a blinking cursor top-left
rebooted and still don't have any VCs
not sure then dude
what is the output of: lsb_release -c ?
lucid.
so you aren't in the admin group?
No I'm not
unlucky
gnome-session something
if you put .desktop files in ~/.configure/autostart  it wil run at login
that's all that app does
Oh right
